div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Feb. 2, 1893. FOR THE EXPOSITION IN CHICAGO

body.p: Warsaw writes: Several photographic establishments are preparing albums of views of the largest industrial plants in Warsaw, Lodz, etc. These albums will be sent to the World's Columbian Exposition in accordance with the instructions received by the industrialists here. Among the most interesting, are the large scale pictures showing the mines and the enormous smelting furnaces in Dabrow and in the vicinity of Sosnowiec. In addition, the ministry of the interior is sending three hundred photographic views of the Bialowies wilderness to the Exposition. These photographs were made by the Warsaw photographers Karoli and Troczewski, with the help of special enlargement apparatuses from Berlin. The photographs were to have been sent out on January 27.
